column4: Hi, how would I use aptitude to install all packages recommended by currently installed packages
can't get the searc expression right :(
I thought I had your answer, but actually, I'd like to know that too.
tried everything, all sorts of complex ?fors. Can't get them right though, I think bash is eating some of the special chars...
do you have many packages to install, or could you simply do it manually in aptitude or synaptic?
I suspect you've tried the man page already?
I can't get ?for to work in aptitude, or anything with ? for that matter
when I press "/" to start a search and type ?name(whatever), it gives me an error

If it's bash, it might not be ubuntu specific - you could try asking in other channels/forums as well, as well as hanging around here.  People join all the time; there will certainly be someone with more experience than I.  My experience is limited with anything beyond reading man pages and basic coding.  Still, I'd like to know the answer as well.  If you happen to find it, let me know.
Figured it out?  Yes, please PM.
